thread.title: Mike Baird goes Back To The Future in a DeLorean
thread.title_full: Mike Baird goes Back To The Future in a DeLorean

title: Mike Baird goes Back To The Future in a DeLorean
text:
Mike Baird goes Back To The Future in a DeLorean Movies 
Please Log in to update your video settings 
Video will begin in 5 seconds. 
Please Log in to update your video settings Mike Baird is back from the future NSW Premier Mike Baird comes back from the future with a message. PT0M27S http://www.smh.com.au/action/externalEmbeddedPlayer?id=d-44w9d 620 349 October 21, 2015 - 1:18PM Take our Back to the Future quiz 
Premier Mike Baird has taken his social media presence to new, cheesier heights with a stunt involving a DeLorean DMC-12. 
Baird has tweeted footage of him arriving for an interview in the iconic Back To The Future car, timed to coincide with "Back To The Future Day". 
Stunt man ... Baird steps out of the DeLorean this morning. 
In the short clip, he steps out of the car and awkwardly delivers the line, "I've just seen the future for New South Wales ... it's fantastic!" Advertisement 
In his tweet he says: "Great Scott!! Turns out we still need roads..." Great Scott!! Turns out we still need roads... #BackToTheFutureDay https://t.co/ve5dOmLMCr — Mike Baird (@mikebairdMP) October 20, 2015 
Baird is becoming increasingly recognised for a slick social media profile that goes to great lengths to appear spontaneous but which is, in fact, carefully managed. 
Last month, "Magic Mike" caused an online sensation with a an apparently spur-of-the-moment session live tweeting The Bachelor finale. Stuck at home on the couch with man-flu. Daughters have hijacked the TV and are watching The Bachelor. Going to be a loooong night. — Mike Baird (@mikebairdMP) September 17, 2015 
The brains behind much of Baird's online tactics, which strategists believe allow him to go direct to voters without relying on traditional media, is believed to be his head of digital media Tony Story. 
October 21 has been declared "Back To The Future Day" because it is the date to which Marty McFly and Doc Emmet Brown travel in Back To The Future: Part II.
